text: Judi Love (born 4 June 1980) is an English stand-up comedian and radio presenter. In 2020, she became a panellist on the ITV talk show Loose Women. == Early and personal life == Born in Hackney, London to Jamaican parents, Love is the youngest of five children. She spent the majority of her youth in and around the East London area. Love studied a degree in Community Arts and Social Science, and a Masters in Social Work from the Tavistock Institute. Love has two children. ==Career== Love began comedy when she performed a set in front of her class for a module, in which she revealed the comedic side of caring for her mother, who died in 2009 with dementia. In 2011, Love made her professional stage debut with a show titled Laughter is Healing. Love hosted the 2019 London Critics' Circle Awards, and in 2020, she began appearing as a panellist on the ITV talk show Loose Women. ==References== ==External links== * * Category:English people of Jamaican descent Category:English women comedians Category:People from the London Borough of Hackney Category:Living people Category:1980 births
title: Judi Love
